Pratyush Banerjee wrote:
>    Hi All,
> 
> I have been working with Heritrix-2.0.0 code for sometime. However i 
> have just written a custom WriterProcessor
> wherein in the initialTasks() i need to get the value for the 
> "max-toe-threads" as set in the global sheet.
> 
> I can access the default value but not the live value whichever way i 
> try. The standard method of global.get() does not
> work since it requires an object instead of the class.
> 
> It would be of great help if somebody can suggest me a method.

MAX_TOE_THREADS is a setting on CrawlControllerImpl, so you'd need an 
instance of that to pass into:

     context.get(controller, CrawlControllerImpl.MAX_TOE_THREADS);

To ensure your processor has such a reference, you should be able to use 
the same technique as used by the RuntimeLimitEnforcer -- an 
autoreference to the CrawlControllerImpl as part of its own settings:

     final public static Key<CrawlControllerImpl> CONTROLLER =
         Key.makeAuto(CrawlControllerImpl.class);

...then in initialTasks()...

     CrawlControllerImpl c = curi.get(this, CONTROLLER);
     int toes = context.get(c, CrawlControllerImpl.MAX_TOE_THREADS);

I haven't tried this, but think it will do what you need.

- Gordon @ IA
